content:
**Which graph shows a quadratic function with range $-5\leq h(x) \leq 3$?**


[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate plane. The x- and y-axes each scale by two. A graph of a line intersects the points (negative 3, 2) and (1, negative 1).

choices.content: ![A segment of a quadratic function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is a filled circle at the point (negative 7, negative 5). There is an open, unfilled filled circle at the point (negative 1, 1). There is a curve between these two points, connecting them. From left to right, it travels up reaching a maximum h of x value at (negative 3, 3), then travels down to the unfilled circle.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/7f508ed9433ca9d3c9193d5ac04485e5c108bb20)

![A segment of a quadratic function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is an open, unfilled circle at the point (negative 7, negative 5). There is a filled filled circle at the point (negative 1, 1). There is a curve between these two points, connecting them. From left to right, it travels up reaching a maximum h of x value at (negative 3, 3), then travels down to the unfilled circle.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a15e180f94cadf8687c88130a4d70cbc6af6cb12)

![A segment of a quadratic function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is an open, unfilled circle at the point (negative 5, negative 8). There is another open, unfilled filled circle at the point (3, negative 8). There is a curve between these two points, connecting them. From left to right, it travels up reaching a maximum h of x value at (negative 1, 8), then travels down to the second unfilled circle.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4ce623c362a2049d210be4057b0ef6900b8f402a)

![A segment of a quadratic function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is a filled circle at the point (negative 5, negative 8). There is another filled filled circle at the point (3, negative 8). There is a curve between these two points, connecting them. From left to right, it travels up reaching a maximum h of x value at (negative 1, 8), then travels down to the second filled circle.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/dce4f3c1a2d6711d0fe72344bde6bdac6d5a4405)
